info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 15 at 2:57AM PST until December 15 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches. Winds gusting up to 50 mph over exposed higher terrain and for areas north of Mount Shasta City. * WHERE...South Central Siskiyou County including portions of Interstate 5 south of Weed and portions of Highway 89 at Snowmans and Dead Horse Summit. This also includes the communities of Mount Shasta City, Dunsmuir, McCloud as well as rural areas east of Mount Shasta City and south of Tennant. * WHEN...From 4 AM to 10 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
